item.title: 以色列前总理的电话联系方式和聊天记录在网上泄露
item.description: 以色列安全官员正在调查前总理纳夫塔利-贝内特（Naftali Bennett）备受瞩目的手机通讯录、照片和信息是如何泄露到网上的。【原文：Israeli security officials are investigating how the high-profile phone contacts, photos and messages belonging to former Prime Minister Naftali Bennett leaked online.】

item.title: 特朗普官员表示支持与加拿大和墨西哥达成贸易协议
item.description: 美国贸易代表贾米森-格里尔（Jamieson Greer）表示，他支持美国继续与加拿大和墨西哥保持贸易协议，但在与立法者的闭门简报中承认，与这两个国家的问题依然存在。【原文：US Trade Representative Jamieson Greer indicated that he supports keeping the US in the trade accord with Canada and Mexico, acknowledging in closed-door briefings with lawmakers that issues with both nations remain.】

item.title: MoonPay 称 CFTC 的 Caroline Pham 将加入加密货币支付公司
item.description: MoonPay 公司表示，商品期货交易委员会代理主席卡罗琳-范（Caroline Pham）将加入这家加密支付公司，担任首席法务官。【原文：MoonPay Inc. said Caroline Pham, the acting chairman of the Commodity Futures Trading Commission, will join the crypto payments firm as its chief legal officer.】

item.title: 亚洲股市下跌，交易员从科技股撤退：市场综述
item.description: 由于全球市场陷入熟悉的风险厌恶模式，科技股和比特币受到科技股担忧的拖累，支持短期国债和贵金属，亚洲股市早盘下跌。【原文：Asian stocks were headed for early declines as global markets fell into a familiar, risk-off pattern with tech concerns weighing on stocks and Bitcoin, supporting short-dated Treasuries and precious metals.】

item.title: DoorDash 将杂货购物引入 ChatGPT，与 Instacart 竞争
item.description: 作为与 OpenAI 计划合作的一部分，DoorDash 公司将在 ChatGPT 中推出杂货购物功能，而就在一周前，竞争对手 Instacart 也宣布推出类似工具。【原文：DoorDash Inc. is launching a grocery shopping feature within ChatGPT as part of a planned partnership with OpenAI, just a week after rival Instacart announced a similar tool.】

item.title: 新西兰第三季度经济增长 1.1%，利率下降
item.description: 新西兰经济在第三季度的反弹幅度超过了经济学家的预测，在经历了第二季度的萎缩之后，利率下降有助于推动经济产出。【原文：New Zealand’s economy rebounded more than economists forecast in the third quarter, with falling interest rates helping drive output after a second-quarter contraction.】

item.title: S&P上调阿根廷评级，认为该国更有能力偿还债务
item.description: S&P全球评级公司将阿根廷的信用等级提高了一个等级，称阿根廷经济指标的改善和政府增加的国会支持使其更有能力偿还债务。【原文：S&P Global Ratings lifted Argentina’s credit score by a notch, saying that improved economic metrics and the governments increased congressional support make it better able to service its debts.】

item.title: 美国证券交易委员会允许贝莱德和摩根大通发售双股票型基金
item.description: 美国证券交易委员会允许包括贝莱德、摩根大通、富达和道富在内的数十家资产管理公司提供多份额类基金。【原文：The US Securities and Exchange Commission is permitting dozens of asset managers including BlackRock, JPMorgan, Fidelity and State Street to offer multi-share class funds.】

item.title: 美联储发布新指引，旨在促进银行创新
item.description: 美联储向银行发布指导意见，鼓励企业从事 "某些创新活动"，这是美国监管机构欢迎新颖的业务合作加入传统金融领域的又一举措。【原文：The Federal Reserve issued guidance to banks that encourages firms to engage in “certain innovative activities,” another step by US regulators to welcome novel business tie-ups into the fold of traditional finance.】

item.title: 出埃及记》工作室负责人卸任，孩之宝聘用视频游戏大亨
item.description:
暴雪资深员工保罗-德拉-比塔（Paul Della Bitta）将接管视频游戏部门

。【原文：

Blizzard veteran Paul Della Bitta will take over the video-game division

】

item.title: 纽约市高线区大楼以 5300 万美元的价格破产出售
item.description: 位于西切尔西（West Chelsea）的一座容纳艺术画廊和摄影师工作室的商业阁楼已申请破产，以阻止其贷款人摩根大通银行（JPMorgan Chase & Co.【原文：A commercial loft housing art galleries and photographers’ studios in West Chelsea has filed for bankruptcy to halt foreclosure by its lender, JPMorgan Chase & Co., as it seeks to close a $53 million deal to sell the property.】

item.title: 美国主要电网成本创下新纪录，经济承受能力面临考验
item.description: 随着人工智能推动的需求激增导致美国最大电网的电力成本上升，从新泽西州到芝加哥的家庭和企业准备为电费支付创纪录的金额。【原文：Households and businesses spanning New Jersey to Chicago are poised to pay record sums for electricity as an AI-fueled demand surge drives up power costs on the largest US grid.】

item.title: 人工智能热潮刺激需求，美光给出乐观的销售预测
item.description: 美国最大的计算机内存芯片制造商美光科技公司（Micron Technology Inc.【原文：Micron Technology Inc., the largest US maker of computer memory chips, gave an upbeat forecast for the current quarter, a sign that surging demand and supply shortages are allowing the company to charge more for products.】

item.title: 日本央行有望将利率上调至 30 年来的最高水平
item.description: 人们普遍预计日本央行周五将把基准利率提高到三十年来的最高水平，这表明人们对日本央行实现稳定通胀目标的信心日益增强。【原文：The Bank of Japan is widely expected to raise its benchmark rate Friday to the highest level in three decades, in a sign of growing confidence that it will achieve its stable inflation target.】

item.title: 委内瑞拉石油储存空间即将耗尽，油轮运输受限
item.description: 继上周扣押油轮和美国计划封堵其他受制裁船只之后，委内瑞拉可能很快就要开始关闭一些油井，因为它的储油能力已经不足。【原文：Venezuela may soon have to start closing some oil wells as it runs low on storage capacity following last week’s tanker seizure and US plans to block other sanctioned vessels.】

item.title: 长期买家套现，比特币的无声出逃打击加密货币
item.description: 比特币最根深蒂固的投资者仍在套现，压力开始显现。【原文：Bitcoin’s most entrenched investors are still cashing out — and the pressure is starting to show.】

item.title: S&P 将巴拉圭评级提升至投资级，加入穆迪行列
item.description: S&P 全球评级公司提高了巴拉圭的信用等级，这是该南美国家第二次获得投资级评级。【原文：S&P Global Ratings lifted Paraguay’s credit score, granting the South American nation its second investment-grade rating.】

item.title: 太空探索技术公司创纪录的首次公开募股（IPO）计划将晦涩难懂的 ETF 推向聚光灯下
item.description: 个人投资者竞相在 SpaceX 上市前抢占一席之地，将一只利基 ETF 推到了聚光灯下，凸显了散户对埃隆-马斯克（Elon Musk）商业帝国的欣喜，以及对私人公司风险敞口的争夺。【原文：A bid by individual investors to grab a sliver of SpaceX before it goes public has propelled a niche ETF into the spotlight, highlighting retail euphoria over Elon Musk’s business empire and the scramble for private-company exposure.】

item.title: 需求保持强劲，2025 年美国 CLO 销售额再创新高
item.description: 今年以来，由于投资者对高收益贷款的需求旺盛，以提供额外保护的形式为收购提供资金，基金经理们出售了大量由杠杆贷款组合支持的债券，创下了历史新高。【原文：Money managers have sold a record amount of bonds backed by portfolios of leveraged loans this year, profiting from heavy demand from investors for higher-yielding loans funding buyouts in a form that offers extra protections.】

item.title: 英国初创企业 Awendio 计划在魁北克建造价值 7.25 亿美元的太阳能电池厂
item.description: 英国初创公司 Awendio Solaris 正在起草计划，准备投资多达 10 亿加元（7.25 亿美元）在加拿大建立一家太阳能技术工厂，但仍需确保电力供应和融资。【原文：British startup Awendio Solaris is drafting plans to invest as much as C$1 billion ($725 million) into a solar technologies factory in Canada, though it still needs to secure power supply and financing.】

item.title: 谷歌起诉中国 "Darcula "组织，指控其实施网络钓鱼计划
item.description: Alphabet Inc. 旗下的谷歌公司对所谓的中国网络犯罪分子提起诉讼，指控该组织策划了一场大规模的网络钓鱼活动，旨在诱骗美国人交出他们的信用卡号码。【原文：Alphabet Inc.’s Google filed a lawsuit against alleged Chinese cybercriminals, accusing the group of orchestrating a vast phishing campaign designed to dupe Americans into turning over their credit card numbers.】

item.title: 引发美国经济负担危机的另一项保险费用
item.description:
美国共和党领导的国会让《平价医疗法案》的补贴失效，引发了成本飙升。

但是，不断上涨的汽车保险费用也让美国人付出了代价。【原文：

The GOP-led Congress is letting Affordable Care Act subsidies lapse, triggering a cost spike. But rising auto insurance bills are taking a toll on Americans, too. 

】

item.title: 英伟达就工程师窃取数据的商业机密案达成和解
item.description: 英伟达公司（Nvidia Corp. ）解决了一起涉及一名前工程师的诉讼，该工程师无意中泄露了他从前任雇主处窃取的自动驾驶商业机密。【原文：Nvidia Corp. settled a lawsuit involving a former engineer who had inadvertently revealed autonomous driving trade secrets that he stole from a previous employer.】

item.title: 马里兰州官员称可能为重要桥梁重建发行债券
item.description: 弗朗西斯-斯科特-基大桥于 2024 年坍塌，中断了一条重要的经济通道，马里兰州官员预计将发行债券，为重建这座大桥提供资金。【原文：Maryland officials anticipate issuing bonds to help finance the rebuilding of the Francis Scott Key Bridge, which collapsed in 2024 and disrupted a major economic gateway.】

item.title: 佛罗里达州 Brightline 公司计划举债 1 亿美元以增强流动性
item.description: 迈阿密和奥兰多之间的私营铁路公司 Brightline 表示，根据其最新的乘客量和收入报告，它正在考虑增发 1 亿美元的债务，用于运营和支付潜在的法律索赔。【原文：Brightline, the private rail line between Miami and Orlando, said it’s considering issuing $100 million in additional debt for operations and to pay potential legal claims, according to its latest ridership and revenue report.】

item.title: 史蒂夫-科恩考虑成立大宗商品部门，对冲基金纷纷下注
item.description: Point72 资产管理公司（Point72 Asset Management）正在考虑建立大宗商品业务，因为多地区对冲基金正跃跃欲试，希望通过大宗商品的波动来提高收益。【原文：Point72 Asset Management is considering building a commodities business as multistrategy hedge funds jump on the volatile play to drive returns.】

item.title: 边境巡逻队节前卷土重来困扰芝加哥经济
item.description: 唐纳德-特朗普总统的移民镇压行动又回到了芝加哥，美国边境巡逻队的突袭行动有可能在假期前扰乱商业活动。【原文：President Donald Trump’s immigration crackdown is returning to Chicago, with raids carried out by US Border Patrol threatening to disrupt businesses before the holidays.】

item.title: 亚马逊任命新任人工智能主管，与技术竞争对手一决高下
item.description: 亚马逊公司（Amazon.com Inc. ）正在重组人工智能项目团队，让公司云计算部门的一位高层领导负责一个新部门。【原文：Amazon.com Inc. is reorganizing teams working on artificial intelligence projects, putting a top leader from the company’s cloud division in charge of a new unit.】

item.title: 伦敦富人区在征收 "豪宅税 "的基础上面临大幅增税
item.description: 在工党政府取消了议会税收上限，以弥补其将资金转移到贫困社区的努力之后，伦敦及其周边的六个富裕地区在未来几年的年税收增幅将超过 5%。【原文：Six wealthy areas in and around London are set for annual tax hikes in excess of 5% in the coming years, after the Labour government lifted a cap on council levies to make up for its efforts to shift funds to poorer communities.】

item.title: 美联储是否应该被幽灵通胀吓倒？
